reasoning: Argentine hemorrhagic fever (Junín virus) is endemic to Argentina's northwest region. Incidence estimated at ~0.05 per 100k person-years (40-100 cases annually during active years, concentrated in endemic zones with ~500k population). Highly geographic-specific with epidemic variability. Using incidence as this is an acute viral infection.
source: Maiztegui JI et al. (1998). Junín virus activity in rodents, Argentina. Emerg Infect Dis. 4(3):409-414
